### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    position VARCHAR(50),
    hourly_rate DECIMAL(10,2)
)

CREATE TABLE shifts (
    shift_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    shift_date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME,
    employee_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE payroll (
    payroll_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    pay_date DATE,
    hours_worked DECIMAL(10,2),
    total_pay DECIMAL(10,2),
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    shift_id INT,
    date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (shift_id) REFERENCES shifts(shift_id)
)

    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (shift_id) REFERENCES shifts(shift_id)
)

### STATEMENT

SELECT e.name, sh.start_time, sh.end_time, TIMESTAMPDIFF(MINUTE, sh.start_time, sh.end_time) AS shift_duration FROM employees e JOIN shifts sh ON e.employee_id = sh.employee_id;

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    position VARCHAR(50),
    hourly_rate DECIMAL(10,2)
)

CREATE TABLE shifts (
    shift_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    shift_date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME,
    employee_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE payroll (
    payroll_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    pay_date DATE,
    hours_worked DECIMAL(10,2),
    total_pay DECIMAL(10,2),
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    shift_id INT,
    date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (shift_id) REFERENCES shifts(shift_id)
)

### STATEMENT

SELECT e.name AS employee_name, SUM(p.total_pay) AS total_payment FROM employees e JOIN shifts sh ON e.employee_id = sh.employee_id JOIN payroll p ON e.employee_id = p.employee_id WHERE sh.shift_date BETWEEN '2022-05-01' AND '2022-05-10' GROUP BY e.name;

### TABLEDATA

    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    position VARCHAR(50),
    hourly_rate DECIMAL(10,2)
)

CREATE TABLE shifts (
    shift_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    shift_date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME,
    employee_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE payroll (
    payroll_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    pay_date DATE,
    hours_worked DECIMAL(10,2),
    total_pay DECIMAL(10,2),
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    shift_id INT,
    date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (shift_id) REFERENCES shifts(shift_id)
)

### STATEMENT

SELECT e.name AS employee_name, COUNT(*) AS shift_count, AVG(p.hours_worked) AS avg_hours_worked FROM employees e JOIN schedule s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id JOIN payroll p ON e.employee_id = p.employee_id GROUP BY e.name;

)

### STATEMENT

SELECT e.position, AVG(p.total_pay) AS avg_pay FROM employees e JOIN payroll p ON e.employee_id = p.employee_id GROUP BY e.position;

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    position VARCHAR(50),
    hourly_rate DECIMAL(10,2)
)

CREATE TABLE shifts (
    shift_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    shift_date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME,
    employee_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE payroll (
    payroll_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    pay_date DATE,
    hours_worked DECIMAL(10,2),
    total_pay DECIMAL(10,2),
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    shift_id INT,
    date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (shift_id) REFERENCES shifts(shift_id)
)

### STATEMENT

SELECT e.name AS employee_name, SUM(p.total_pay) AS total_payment FROM employees e JOIN shifts sh ON e.employee_id = sh.employee_id JOIN payroll p ON e.employee_id = p.employee_id WHERE sh.shift_date BETWEEN '2022-05-01' AND '2022-05-10' GROUP BY e.name HAVING total_payment > 1000.00;

### TABLEDATA

CREATE TABLE employees (
    employee_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(50),
    position VARCHAR(50),
    hourly_rate DECIMAL(10,2)
)

CREATE TABLE shifts (
    shift_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    shift_date DATE,
    start_time TIME,
    end_time TIME,
    employee_id INT,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE payroll (
    payroll_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    pay_date DATE,
    hours_worked DECIMAL(10,2),
    total_pay DECIMAL(10,2),
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id)
)

CREATE TABLE schedule (
    schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    employee_id INT,
    shift_id INT,
    date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (employee_id) REFERENCES employees(employee_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (shift_id) REFERENCES shifts(shift_id)
)

### STATEMENT

SELECT e.name AS employee_name, COUNT(*) AS shift_count, AVG(p.hours_worked) AS avg_hours_worked FROM employees e JOIN schedule s ON e.employee_id = s.employee_id JOIN payroll p ON e.employee_id = p.employee_id GROUP BY e.name HAVING avg_hours_worked > 30.00;
